text: welcome to this series on mastitis in dairy cows brought to you by the University of Edinburgh this video is the hygiene in the shed let the cows tell you a scoring system mastitis is the infection of the milk producing glands the other bacteria invade the teat end via the teat canal and cause an infection mastitis is a fight between bacteria invading the other and the cow fighting the infection hygiene in the sheds let the cows tell you there are many different housing systems depending on the number of cows and the space that they have clean cows mean the system is working daddy cows means it needs attention clean cows will have less mastitis hygiene scouring this lets the cows tell you if you have a problem each cow is called in three areas on a scale of 0 to 2 the areas are the flank including the tail the lower hind leg and the other houses caught in this areas as follows clean cows with only splashes of manure score a zero if there's more than a palm-sized amount of dirtiness it's called a 1 if there's more than a four I'm length of dirtiness then score a two any score of two suggests is a problem of shed hygiene if only the lower hind legs are dirty then the problem is likely to be cleaning of passageways or drainage where the cows are working if the other and the lower part of the cows are dirty then it is a problem with where the cows are lying if it is around the tail on the flank where the tail swishes is it a problem of diarrhea is there a problem with the diet if the dirtiness is all over is there perhaps a problem with overcrowding or manure removal you
